item.title: Baked Sea Bass with Peppers
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Serves 2, oven at 200°C, takes around 50 minutes overall. Goes well with green beans. From Judith’s green recipe book. 2 halves sea bass1 red pepper, cut into chunks1 yellow pepper, ditto1 small red onion, cut into wedges2 tomatoes, quartered25g pine nuts15g parsley, choppedOlive oilSalt Put peppers, tomatoes, onion, and salt in a small roasting […]

item.title: Vegetable Lasagne
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.category: Does not kill in five minutes
item.description: Serves 4–6, oven at 180°C. Ragu 2×400g tins chopped tomatoes2 onions, chopped1 carrot, chopped1 stick celery, chopped1 tsp sugar10 tbsp olive oil2 tsp dried oregano1–2 garlic cloves, crushed1 green and 1 red pepper, de-seeded and chopped225g courgettes, thinly sliced225g mushrooms, sliced White Sauce 750ml milk50g margarine50g flourground nutmeg Lasagne 250g lasagneparmesan cheese This needs big […]

item.title: Beans on Toast
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Not really beans on toast at all, but that’s the name that brings it to mind. It’s a chickpea and tomato stew really. Ian! Next time, try adding a frozen spinach block to the bean mix. Generous quantities for 4 2 onions, garlic, finely chopped2 potatoes, boiled and cubed2 tsp cumin (optionally the same of […]

item.title: Oil and Vinegar Chocolate Cake
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: (serves ??, oven at 180°C) 200g plain flour220g granulated sugar30g cocoa powder1 tsp bicarbonate of soda½ tsp salt1 tbsp white vinegar100ml vegetable oil2 tsp instant coffee250ml water 20cm square tin Mix dry ingredients in a bowl, add remaining ingredients then stir. Pour into tin and bake in a pre-heated oven at 180°C for 30 minutes […]

item.title: Upside-Down Pudding
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: (serves 4–6, oven at 180–190°C) 1oz butterTinned or fresh fruit (pineapple rings, apricot halves)Light brown sugar6oz self-raising flourPinch salt3 eggs6oz caster sugar3oz margarine8″ square tin(Watch out for the leaky tin. Caitlin has the other one.) Melt butter in tin, sprinkle thickly with sugar. Arrange fruit to cover base closely “with an attractive design”. Mix remaining […]

item.title: Apple Chicken Salad
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Lunch mix for one. Based on: http://www.lecremedelacrumb.com/2015/01/fuji-apple-chicken-salad-panera-bread-copycat.html 1 chicken breast, cooked, chopped lettucepecan halvesgorgonzolaapple chipsapple salad dressing (olive oil, apple cider vinegar, mustard, apple juice)

item.title: Stovies
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: (Oven 180°C) 1 onion1lb sausages, or other meat. Cut sausages in half or smaller.Potatoes, peeled and sliced.1pt stock Fry onion and meat in oil. Layer sliced potatoes over meat. Cover and cook in oven for 30mins. Serve with vegetables. Serves 4, possibly. I’m not too sure about the quantities of potato.

item.title: Cornish Pasties
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Really Devon Pasties, based on recipe from Guardian Saturday Family. http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2011/jan/22/snapshot-playlist-we-love-to-eat Quantities for 4, but see lots of notes below. 1lb Chuck steak 2–3 Potatoes 2–3 Onions 500g Pastry (short crust) 1 beaten egg for glaze For vegetarian pasty, throw in a carrot and some grated cheese instead of the steak. Chop all ingredients into […]

item.title: Bean Mush
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: (Quantities for 3–4) 1 onion1 tbsp olive oilTin red kidney beansTin black-eyed beans (or cannellini, or borlotti)(We don’t always have black-eyed beans. So be prepared to use one of the others.)Tin tomatoesTomato purée4oz mushrooms1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce8oz mozarella1 tbsp chopped parsley Fry onion in oil. Add other ingredients up to and including the Worcestershire sauce, […]
